es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command
Class TakeCommand

java.lang.Object
  es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.Command
      es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.TakeCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class TakeCommand
extends Command

Represents a Take command from the player that moves an item from the player location to the player inventory.

  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.takeCommand" which default value is "take".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.takeCommand.abbrev" which default value is "t".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.takeCommand.alt" which default value is "pick".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.help" which default value is "(take|t|pick) ".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.itemNameNotInLocation" which default value is "There is no item with that name in this location.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.itemNameRepeatedInLocation" which default value is "There are several items with that name in this location.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.itemNameAlreadyInInventory" which default value is "There is another item with that name in the inventory.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.success" which default value is "It has been taken.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.failure" which default value is "That item cannot be taken from this location.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.undoSuccess" which default value is "It has returned to this location.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.takeCommand.undoFailure" which default value is "The item cannot return to this location from the inventory.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "flag.takeCommand.allowFIFODisambiguationForItemNameRepeatedInLocation" which default value is "false".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "flag.takeCommand.allowRepetitionsInInventoryItemNames" which default value is "false".

Constructor Detail

TakeCommand

public TakeCommand(Game game)
Constructs a Take command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. Default configuration is assumed at this moment.

Parameters:
game - The game.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'game' cannot be null.

TakeCommand

public TakeCommand(Game game,
                   java.util.Properties config)
Constructs a Take command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. The properties defined in the given configuration override those of the default configuration.

Parameters:
game - The game.
config - The configuration.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments 'game' and 'config' cannot be null.
Method Detail

setConfiguration

private void setConfiguration()
Sets the specific configuration given in the properties file

setDefaultConfiguration

private void setDefaultConfiguration()
Sets the default configuration

execute

public boolean execute()
Executes the Take command, moving the item from the player location to the player inventory, if it is possible. When the item name is repeated in the player location, this command may fail or allow a FIFO disambiguation (chosing the first item with that name that was added to the location), depending on the configuration. When there is already an item with that name in the inventory, this command may fail or succeed (taking the item anyway), depending on the configuration.

Overrides:
execute in class Command
Returns:
true if the command has been correctly executed; false otherwise.
See Also:
Command.execute()

Specified by:

Returns:
The help information.

Command.getHelp()

parse

public boolean parse(java.lang.String line)
Parses a text line trying to identify a player invocation to this Take command (e.g. "take sword").

Specified by:
parse in class Command
Parameters:
line - The text line.
Returns:
true if the text line has been correctly parsed and the command correctly configured; false otherwise.
See Also:
Command.parse(String)

undo

public boolean undo()
Undoes the Take command execution, moving the item back from the player inventory to the player location, if it is possible.

Overrides:
undo in class Command
Returns:
true if the command has been correctly undone; false otherwise.
See Also:
Command.undo()

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation for this object: TakeCommand[item]. This is useful for debugging purposes.

Specified by:
toString in class Command
